intro: Ruschia jacobseniana, commonly known as the Jacobsen's Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and yellow. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and arid landscapes. Due to its hardy nature, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in warm climates.
